instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Nand MLC chip data Recover
threads.message:
Hi,

I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12 inch dead  logic board, that need the data. this is common <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> issue board that has cpu vcore but black screen.

I'm wondering is it possible to pull the 2X nand MLC chips and put to working board or to nand reader to recover the data?

or is this encrypted like ipones?

Please advice me.

Thank you,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Nand MLC chip data Recover
threads.message:
You need to swap all the chips from SSD area, including its ROM...
Be aware, is not easy job and you can get 2 non-working boards at the end.
Go ahead only if client accepts a "good" price (for you).
